sorry - was focused elsewhere - you should be able to go to Ubuntu Software Center -> Edit -> Software Sources - Other Software tab and unclick the PPAs you no longer need, then 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade'
but it seems that not all ppas are listed there?
then you might need to 'sudo editor /etc/apt/sources.list' and manually comment out any other unwanted sources and move any files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ to [filename].old or something
(if you prefer gedit, just do 'gksudo gedit' in place of 'sudo editor'
